channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.
channel.copyright: Copyright:(C) Wed, 16 Oct 2024 08:52:49 IST Bennett Coleman & Co. Ltd, http://in.indiatimes.com/policyterms/1554651.cms

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Chinese aquarium criticised for using robot instead of real Whale Shark
item.description: Xiaomeisha Sea World in Shenzhen faced backlash for showcasing a mechanical whale shark after five years of renovations. Critics highlighted the robot's visible gaps and the high entry fee of $40, expressing disappointment on social media. The aquarium defended the decision, citing laws against trading live whale sharks, but visitors remained dissatisfied.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'No one should go to jail for smoking weed': Harris promises to legalise recreational marijuana
item.description: Kamala Harris promises to legalize recreational marijuana if elected, emphasizing its disproportionate impact on Black men. She aims to work with Congress to ensure lawful cultivation, distribution, and possession of cannabis, and plans to support Black entrepreneurs through forgivable loans and better regulation.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Possess, control, impregnate her': Olivia Nuzzi's ex-fiancé claims RFK jr manipulated her
item.description: Ryan Lizza claims Olivia Nuzzi had a toxic affair with RFK Jr., describes him as a sex addict who manipulated her. Nuzzi accuses Lizza of harassment and blackmail after he encouraged her to disclose the affair. Nuzzi, currently on leave, seeks a protective order against Lizza. RFK Jr. denies the accusations.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Over 800 US military veterans released under 'don’t ask, don’t tell' policy receive honorable discharges
item.description: More than 800 military personnel discharged under the “don’t ask, don’t tell” policy have had their service records upgraded to honorable discharges. This initiative, part of a review by defense secretary Lloyd Austin, aims to rectify past discrimination against LGBTQ service members in the US military.
item.dc:creator: TOI News Desk

item.title: UN says Yemen risks being dragged into Mideast conflict that could spiral out of control
Georgia kicks off early voting with record-breaking 2,50,000 ballot casts
item.description: Georgia sees a record-breaking early voting turnout, with over 252,000 votes cast on the first day, highlighting its battleground status. This surpasses the previous 2020 record of 136,000 votes. Former President Jimmy Carter, aged 100, also participated. New regulations may impact absentee voting, but officials ensure election security and accuracy amidst high voter enthusiasm.

item.title: British Indians most successful ethnic group in UK: report
item.description: A report by Policy Exchange highlights the Indian community in Britain as the top-performing ethnic group in professions, pay rates, home ownership, and social integration. Despite high achievements, social class, rather than race, remains the key barrier to success. The rise of 'minorities in towns' is led by aspirational British Indians, shaping future electoral battlegrounds.
item.dc:creator: Naomi Canton

item.title: Donald Trump clashes with Bloomberg editor over tariff: 'Must be hard for you...'
item.description: Trump said higher tariffs would make it more likely for foreign companies to build factories in the United States. "I was always very good at Mathematics," Trump said as he added that he's all about growth and will bring companies to the country. He also said that tariff is his favorite word in the dictionary.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Harris vs Trump is now 50/50 in Nate Silver's latest prediction
item.description: Nate Silver's latest forecast indicates a 50/50 race between Kamala Harris and Donald Trump, while the NBC latest poll also shows both candidates at 48% support. Movement towards Trump in key states has tightened the contest. The campaign heats up with Harris questioning Trump's fitness report and Trump cancelling another mainstream press interview.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Lufthansa fined $4 million for blocking 128 Jewish passengers in 2022
item.description: German airline Lufthansa faced a $4 million fine by the US government for denying boarding to 128 Orthodox Jewish passengers in 2022, citing alleged misbehavior. Lufthansa apologized, denying any discrimination, and has since partnered with the American Jewish Committee to develop an anti-discrimination training program for their staff. Lufthansa agreed to pay $2 million and the Department of Transportation said it will credit the airline with $2 million that it paid in compensation to passengers.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Did Trump dance for 30 minutes? Or was he 'lost, confused, frozen'? Here's what happened
item.description: As the video of Donald Trump standing on the stage doing nothing went viral, Trump supporters claimed that the Kamala Harris campaign doctored the video as desperate measures while Trump actually decided to play music for the town hall after there were two medical emergencies. The medical emergencies that took place to some audience members came as lengthy interruptions to Donald Trump's townhall and so the former president opted to play several of his favorite songs to the crowd.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Cushions, carpet, no negative comments: List of Meghan, Harry's bizarre demands for 2021 school visit revealed
item.description: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle visited a low-income school in New York for their Netflix documentary and made several unusual requests like new carpets and cushions for Meghan's aesthetic. Their team sought extensive control over media and consent forms to avoid any negative remarks. Only 'Meghan-friendly' publications were allowed to cover the visit.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: No one was sick but Delta cancels meal services on 200 flights over 'safety issue'
item.description: Delta Airlines halted in-flight meal services on over 200 flights from Detroit Metro Airport after an FDA inspection found a food safety issue at its catering partner's kitchen. Though no illnesses were reported, the airline is revising food preparation methods and used alternative meal options and compensations for affected passengers. “Delta and its catering partner immediately shut down hot food production and subsequently suspended all activity from the facility,” the airline said in a statement.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump reveals Barron loves Bussin' with the Boys podcast, 'He told me you got to...'
item.description: Former president Donald Trump made an appearance at the football show Bussin' With The Boys with Will Compton and Taylor Lewan and as he congratulated the show, he revealed that his son loves them. "My son said dad, you got to do those with them. Those guys are great. You know I have a son of 6'9''. How tall are you?" Donald Trump asked the hosts. Taylor Lewan said he is 6.7. Then Donald Trump told how good Barron Trump is at his studies etc.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Startling report says Israeli forces used Palestinian detainees as human shields in booby-traps
item.description: A New York Times report alleges that Israeli soldiers and intelligence agents used captured Palestinians as human shields in Gaza during the conflict against Hamas. Despite the Israel Defense Forces denying these claims, the investigation revealed that detainees were forced into dangerous reconnaissance missions, an act prohibited under Israeli and international law. The practice was reportedly routine, with involvement from senior intelligence officers.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Imran Khan kept in dark cell, isolated; no weekly calls to sons: Ex-wife Jemima
item.description: Jemima said she had come to know that the authorities are torturing Imran Khan by completely isolating him. "We have received reports that the authorities have now turned off the lights and electricity in his cell and he is no longer allowed to leave his cell at any time. The jail cook has been sent on leave. He is now completely isolated, in solitary confinement, literally in the dark, with no contact with the outside world. His lawyers are concerned about his safety and well-being," Jemima wrote.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Watch: Donald Trump forgets election day? 'If everybody votes on January 5'
item.description: “If everything works out, if everybody gets out and votes on January 5th or before. You know, it used to be, you'd have a date. Today you can vote two months before, probably three months after, they don't know what the hell they're doing. But we’re gonna straighten it all out. We’re gonna straighten that out, too. We’re gonna straighten out our election process, too," Trump said at Pennsylvania. “He mixed up his coup date and the election date,” an X user wrote.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Father would have agreed': Director Stanley Kubrick's daughter defends Trump's campaign use of 'Full Metal Jacket'
item.description: Donald Trump uses 'Full Metal Jacket' character to support his vision for a stronger military and mock Biden administration's LGBTQ+ policies. The video contrasts harsh drill scenes with clips supporting LGBTQ+ rights, aiming to promote his 'Make Our Military Great Again' message. Critics call his use manipulative and a twist of Kubrick's anti-war message.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Social media users label Kamala Harris a 'con artist' after plagiarism charges
item.description: US Vice President Kamala Harris faces plagiarism allegations for her 2009 book 'Smart on Crime,' co-authored with Joan O’C. Hamilton. Claims suggest she lifted material from uncited sources like Wikipedia. The New York Times acknowledged these 'lapses' but faced backlash on social media for seemingly deflecting blame onto conservatives who highlighted the issue.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Donald Trump on skipping 60 Minutes interview: 'Worst and most blatant scandal'
item.description: ​"I’ve done 60 Minutes many times, even back in the good ol’ days when Journalism was respected and legit, but I have never seen a very poor answer being REPLACED by another, totally unrelated answer, in order to save the person great personal and professional embarrassment," Donald Trump posted on Truth Social.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
